subprocess_flow.description: Warehouse staff receives a notification indicating that new inventory for the out-of-stock product has arrived and is ready for restocking.
success_criteria: Warehouse staff receives notification of new inventory arrival

subprocess_flow.description: Warehouse staff prioritizes the restocking task based on the urgency of the stock-out and any pre-defined prioritization rules.
Automated Guided Vehicles (AGVs) are dispatched to retrieve the required quantity of the out-of-stock product from its designated storage location in the warehouse.
success_criteria: AGVs successfully retrieve the required inventory

subprocess_flow.description: The AGVs transport the retrieved inventory to the designated restocking location on the sales floor, following optimized routes to minimize travel time.
success_criteria: Inventory is transported to the correct sales floor location

subprocess_flow.description: Sales associates receive the inventory from the AGVs and place it on the shelves or displays, ensuring proper placement and presentation.
success_criteria: Inventory is correctly placed on shelves and displays

subprocess_flow.description: Sales associates update the POS system to reflect the new stock levels, ensuring accurate inventory data is available for sales and reporting.
outputs: POS system updated with new stock levels
success_criteria: POS system accurately reflects the new stock levels

subprocess_flow.description: The inventory management system automatically notifies sales associates (via mobile devices) upon completion of the restocking process, confirming that the product is now available for sale.
inputs: POS system updated with new stock levels
success_criteria: Sales associates receive confirmation of restocking completion
